head.title: A Race to Achieve Clean Energy

hedline.hl1: A Race to Achieve Clean Energy

block.p: Thomas L. Friedman's statement that ''the biggest energy deficit we have right now in America is the energy to lead on this issue'' is reminiscent of the United States-Soviet space race.

President John F. Kennedy's response to the Soviets' perceived technological advantage, fueled by their sending the first man into space, is something we can learn from today, and could help close the leadership gap.
J.F.K. spoke to the values and aspirations of Americans about his bold vision for sending a man safely to the moon (and back) within the decade. Just eight years later, mission accomplished.
In stark contrast, President Bush has provided feeble leadership, and the Democrats have yet to put forth a plan as large as the problem.
To avoid a leadership gap, and to combat global warming, we need a transformative energy initiative equal to a moon shot.
We also need leaders with the vision and courage to launch it.
